1.english: The Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing him, asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
1.wedau: [pharisees] ma [sadducees] neꞌi ma [testing] tauna rau-baghei tauna da atataiyana hita  [sign] au marei

2.english: But he answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
2.wedau: tuna tauna [answered] hita [“when] tauna  madegha omi riwa [‘it] ina  [fair] [weather] yamna  [sky]  [red’]

3.english: In the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can’t discern the signs of the times!
3.wedau: au  maratomtom [‘it] ina  [foul] [weather] [today] yamna  [sky]  [red] ma [threatening’] [hypocrites!] omi haramaneꞌi aiwaꞌi da [discern]  [appearance] ana  [sky] tuna omi [can’t] [discern]  [signs] ana  [times!]

4.english: An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there will be no sign given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” He left them, and departed.
4.wedau: [an] [evil] ma [adulterous] [generation] [seeks] muriyai  [sign] ma kampa ina  egha [sign] verei da tauna [except]  [sign] ana  peroveta [jonah”] tauna voterei hita ma [departed]
4.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

5.english: The disciples came to the other side and had forgotten to take bread.
5.wedau: tauvotaghotagho neꞌi da  ghehauna [side] ma ana [forgotten] da varahai [bread]

6.english: Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
6.wedau: Yesu riwa da hita [“take] tauna ma [beware] ana  [yeast] ana  [pharisees] ma [sadducees”]

7.english: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “We brought no bread.”

8.english: Jesus, perceiving it, said, “Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, ‘because you have brought no bread?’
8.wedau: Yesu [perceiving] tauna riwa [“why] rura omi [reason] [among] [yourselves] omi ana [little] [faith] [‘because] omi ana neiyahi egha [bread?’]
8.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.64); Strong secondary: Love

9.english: Don’t you yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
9.wedau: [don’t] omi [yet] [perceive] [neither] [remember]  [five] [loaves] yamna  [five] [thousand] ma aiwaꞌi anatapuhi [baskets] omi varahai [up?]

10.english: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
10.wedau: [nor]  [seven] [loaves] yamna  [four] [thousand] ma aiwaꞌi anatapuhi [baskets] omi varahai [up?]

11.english: How is it that you don’t perceive that I didn’t speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
11.wedau: aiwaꞌi  tauna raketana omi [don’t] [perceive] raketana tau [didn’t] pa da omi [concerning] [bread?] tuna [beware] ana  [yeast] ana  [pharisees] ma [sadducees”]

12.english: Then they understood that he didn’t tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
12.wedau: maratagogi tauhi [understood] raketana tauna [didn’t] riwehi hita da [beware] ana  [yeast] ana [bread] tuna ana  viharaharamana ana  [pharisees] ma [sadducees]

13.english: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
13.wedau: ina marana maranaina Yesu neꞌi au  [parts] ana [caesarea] [philippi] tauna rau-baghei ana tauvotaghotagho riwa ipa [“who] rura rava riwa raketana tau  natuna ana oroto [am?”]
13.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.64); Strong secondary: Love

14.english: They said, “Some say John the Baptizer, some, Elijah, and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”
14.wedau: tauhi riwa [“some] riwa john  [baptizer] ghehauhi [elijah] ma ghehauna [jeremiah] bo [one] ana  [prophets”]

15.english: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
15.wedau: tauna riwa da hita [“but] aiyai rura omi riwa raketana tau [am?”]

16.english: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
16.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

17.english: Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.
17.wedau: Yesu [answered] tauna [“blessed]  omi simon [bar] [jonah] yamna [flesh] ma [blood] ana egha [revealed] ina da omi tuna au Tamatei aiyai  au marei

18.english: I also tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.
18.wedau: tau maitehi riwehi omi raketana omi  [peter] ma au ina [rock] tau ina [build] au [assembly] ma  [gates] ana ana ina egha [prevail] awarina tauna

19.english: I will give to you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven; and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”
19.wedau: tau ina verei da omi  [keys] ana  vibadana ana marei ma [whatever] omi [bind] au dobuna ina ana  [bound] au [heaven;] ma [whatever] omi [release] au dobuna ina ana  [released] au [heaven”]
19.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.77); Strong secondary: Wisdom

20.english: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.
20.wedau: maratagogi tauna ririweiya  tauvotaghotagho raketana tauhi ina riwehi egha [one] raketana tauna  Yesu  Keriso
20.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.73); Strong secondary: Love

21.english: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.
21.wedau: au raketana mara Yesu [began] da atataiyana ana tauvotaghotagho raketana tauna ina nae da jerusalem ma [suffer] anatapuhi [things] au  [elders] [chief] pirisina ma tauviharaharamanahi ma  [killed] ma  [third] mara  [raised] au

22.english: Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him, saying, “Far be it from you, Lord! This will never be done to you.”
22.wedau: [peter] varahai tauna [aside] ma [began] da [rebuke] tauna riwa ipa [“far]  tauna au omi [lord!] ina ina [never]  [done] da [you”]

23.english: But he turned, and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.”
23.wedau: tuna tauna [turned] ma riwa da [peter] [“get] [behind] tau [satan!] omi   [stumbling] [block] da tau yamna omi  egha [setting] ami [mind] au  [things] ana God tuna au  [things] ana [men”]

24.english: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
24.wedau: maratagogi Yesu riwa da ana tauvotaghotagho [“if] [anyone] [desires] da neꞌi muriyai tau ita tauna [deny] [himself] ma varahai au ana [cross] ma votaghou tau

25.english: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.
25.wedau: yamna [whoever] [desires] da [save] ana yawahana ina [lose] tauna ma [whoever] ina [lose] ana yawahana yamna au [sake] ina [find] tauna

26.english: For what will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world, and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?
26.wedau: yamna aiwaꞌi ina tauna [profit]  oroto tora tauna [gains]  [whole] dobuna ma [forfeits] ana [life?] bo aiwaꞌi ina  oroto verei au [exchange] yamna ana [life?]

27.english: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.
27.wedau: yamna  natuna ana oroto ina neꞌi au  [glory] ana ana Tamatei maitehi ana aneya ma maratagogi tauna ina [render] da anatapuhi [according] da ana [deeds]

28.english: Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”
28.wedau: anatapuhi [certainly] tau riwehi omi kampa  ghehauhi [standing] ina aiyai ina au egha parata [taste] ana mate [until] tauhi inana  natuna ana oroto naenae au ana [kingdom”]
28.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.66); Strong secondary: Justice
